Edwin Nguli

Nairobi · P.O BOX 58436 - 00100 · +254 686 559 · eddynguli@email.com

Highly motivated and results-oriented IT and project operations management professional with exceptional leadership and technical skills. Currently serving as a Field Coordinator with the Development Impact Evaluations (DIME) arm of The World Bank, collaborating with partners worldwide to develop impact evaluations that drive positive change in society and economies. Additionally, I have had experience as a Consultant Project Manager for Echo Mobile, a leading tech startup in Kenya that offers Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) mobile communication platforms for organizations and provides data analysis services. With a track record of exemplary technical and field operations support, I excel in team leadership, research and impact evaluations, systems evaluation, and IT hardware and software configuration.

Experience

Project Field Coordinator

Development Impact Evaluation (DIME), World Bank Group

As a Field Coordinator for DIME, I was responsible for coordinating impact evaluations in the country where they were taking place. This involved operationalizing research questions and designs into operationally relevant implementation strategies, liaising with the project implementation team and other relevant local authorities, and monitoring project implementation to ensure adherence to research design. I was also responsible for supervising data collection in the field and serving as a focal point for communication with various project stakeholders.

Responsibilities
  • Facilitating meetings and updating the team on impact evaluation related activities
  • Supporting the monitoring and evaluation (M&E) staff
  • Monitoring project implementation and updating the research team on any changes or threats to the research design
  • Supervising data collection in the field and serving as focal point for communication with various project stakeholders
  • Helping prepare for data collection, monitoring data quality, and data management
  • Supervising enumerator training and working with the survey firm on drafting enumerator manual(s)
  • Planning field mobilization and updating enumerators on backchecking incoming data
  • Ensuring that the implementation team was in the loop on all IE activities and seeking out ways in which the IE could support implementation at-large
Achievements
  • Successfully coordinated multiple impact evaluations in the field
  • Ensured timely and accurate data collection, contributing to the quality of the research findings
  • Improved communication and coordination between the project implementation team and research team
  • Developed and implemented new strategies for monitoring project implementation and data quality control
  • Received positive feedback from project stakeholders for my strong leadership and coordination skills
September 2019 - Present

Consultant Project Manager

Echo Mobile

As the Deployment Team Lead within Echo Mobile's Deployment Department, I oversaw a collaborative project with a group of University of California researchers, leveraging my leadership and communication skills to ensure seamless coordination and timely deployment activities. Through effective guidance and support of a skilled team, I was able to facilitate a partnership that resulted in the delivery of a successful solution exceeding our client's expectations and providing valuable consumer behavior insights. I am proud of my team's dedication and talent and look forward to applying my skills and experience to future projects.

Responsibilities
  • Designed and deployed mobile phone surveys to be administered to passengers, owners, and managers in the minibus industry in Kenya.
  • Collaborated in the design and development of new ideas, methods, and treatments utilizing the Smart Matatu project tracker technology and safety information to improve safety on public roads.
  • Coordinated relationships with relevant stakeholders in various SACCOs (mini bus management companies) and other local government stakeholders.
  • Configured, supervised, and monitored the installation and use of trackers on minibuses plying long-distance routes.
  • Managed and coordinated a team of enumerators whose role was to interview passengers and provide safety information.
  • Supported the UCB team with data analysis using tools such as Excel and R.
Achievements
  • Successfully oversaw and maintained good relationships with various stakeholders in the project, including minibus owners and SACCO management.
  • Demonstrated strong decision-making and teamwork skills, successfully steering various aspects of the project in the different roles I took on under this project.
  • Successfully managed the project within the allocated budget and timelines, ensuring that all milestones were achieved on time and to the required quality standards.

February 2019 - December 2022

Research Project Manager

University of California, Berkeley (UCB) Economics Research Team

As a Research Project Manager for the University of California, Berkeley Economics Research Team, I led the implementation of two research projects in collaboration with Jumia, Africa's largest e-commerce platform. These projects were crucial in understanding how clients who use the Jumia platform and small businesses that get onboarded to sell their products interact with the e-commerce platform. I was responsible for managing the projects' progress and ensuring the production of high-quality data using unique tools we designed for these projects. Additionally, I analyzed data from Jumia and documented recommendations that assisted Jumia in improving their operations to achieve better efficiency, increase profits and improve customer satisfaction.

Responsibilities
  • Established rapport and maintained trust with various heads at Jumia to ensure smooth progress of projects.
  • Monitored and coordinated the various stages of the project, including participating in the creation of surveys, coordinating daily operations, and taking steps to ensure the production of high-quality data.
  • Analyzed data from the partner organization and created reports on various stages of the projects' progress as well as results witnessed from the analysis of data retrieved.
  • Installed and drove the utilization of necessary plugins/ software on computers, facilitating the changing of names and avatars to understand how clients react to these changes in one project.
  • Worked hand in hand with the project Principal Investigators (PIs) in the preparation of documents and presentations for donor reporting, as well as dissemination activities.
Achievements
  • Established and maintained a good rapport with key personnel within Jumia to ensure smooth operations over time.
  • Enhanced data analysis skills using the R programming language.
  • Coordinated operations for the various stages of the project with a 95-100% success rate.
  • Successfully managed a team of researchers and ensured that all team members were well-equipped with the necessary tools and resources to carry out their responsibilities effectively.
  • Developed innovative strategies for collecting and analyzing data, resulting in more accurate and insightful findings for both projects.
  • Contributed to the development of a comprehensive report on the findings of the research projects, which was highly praised by both Jumia and the University of California, Berkeley.
  • Presented the results of the research projects to key stakeholders, including Jumia executives and academic experts in the field of e￾commerce, and received positive feedback on the quality of the presentations and the insights provided.
  • Fostered a collaborative and supportive work environment within the team, leading to increased motivation, productivity, and job Fostered a collaborative and supportive work environment within the team, leading to increased motivation, productivity, and job satisfaction among team members.satisfaction among team members.
